sentence.Network_en: In the background, dressed in pale green, stood Eunice.
sentence.Network_cn: 尤妮斯穿着浅绿色的衣服站在后面不起眼的地方。

sentence.Network_en: At the horizon the land mass becomes a continuous pale neutral grey.
sentence.Network_cn: 陆地在地平线处变成了一片浅灰。

sentence.Network_en: Pale colours are much more in vogue than autumnal bronzes and coppers.
sentence.Network_cn: 浅色比黄褐色和红棕色这些秋季色彩更流行。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 越轨的，为社会所不容的：不可挽回的无法接受或不合理

lj.lj_ly: behavior that was quite beyond the pale.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French pale, from Latin pallidus; the verb is from Old French palir
Middle English: from Old French pal, from Latin palus 'stake'

entry.def: If something is pale, it is very light in colour or almost white.

example.ex: Migrating birds filled the pale sky...
example.tran: 灰白的天空中满是迁徙的飞鸟。

example.ex: As we age, our skin becomes paler.
example.tran: 随着年龄的增长，我们的皮肤愈见苍白。

entry.def: If someone looks pale, their face looks a lighter colour than usual, usually because they are ill, frightened, or shocked.

example.tran: 她看起来脸色苍白憔悴。

entry.def: If one thing pales in comparison with another, it is made to seem much less important, serious, or good by it.

example.ex: When someone you love has a life-threatening illness, everything else pales in comparison.
example.tran: 你爱的人得了致命疾病时，其他一切事情都显得不那么重要了。

example.ex: ...a soap opera against which other soaps pale into insignificance.
example.tran: 让其他同类剧相形见绌的肥皂剧

entry.def: If you think that someone's actions or behaviour are not acceptable, you can say that they are beyond the pale.

example.ex: This sort of thing really is quite beyond the pale.
example.tran: 这种事情真是不可接受。

example.ex: ...beyond the pale of acceptable human behaviour.
example.tran: 超出可接受的人类行为的范围

means.word_mean: 1. a wooden strip forming part of a fence
1. turn pale, as if in fear
1. very light colored; highly diluted with white;
2. (of light) lacking in intensity or brightness; dim or feeble;

sentences.sentence: "the pale light of a half moon"
"the late afternoon light coming through the el tracks fell in pale oblongs on the street"

means.word_mean: 3. lacking in vitality or interest or effectiveness;

sentences.sentence: "pale prose with the faint sweetness of lavender"

means.word_mean: 4. abnormally deficient in color as suggesting physical or emotional distress;

auth_sentence.content: Whip the butter and sugar until pale and fluffy.
auth_sentence.res_content: Whip the butter and sugar until pale and fluffy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Whip the butter and sugar until pale and fluffy.

auth_sentence.content: He looked pale and haggard, and years older.
auth_sentence.res_content: He looked pale and haggard, and years older.

auth_sentence.res_content: A pale man with inquisitive, almost colourless eyes.

sentences.en: She turned pale at the sight of the miserable condition.
sentences.cn: 她一看到这惨状就面容失色。

sentences.en: The walls were painted a pale green.
sentences.cn: 那些墙壁被漆成浅绿色。

means.word_mean: 变得苍白, 失色, 变得暗淡

sentences.en: He paled at the sight of the blood.
sentences.cn: 他一看见血就脸色发白。

sentences.en: Mother paled with shock at the news.
sentences.cn: 妈妈听到那消息大惊失色。

jushi.english: We walked at a quick pace in the pale moon.
jushi.chinese: 我们在淡淡的月光下迅速地走着。

jushi.english: In the pale moon, you look so beautiful.
jushi.chinese: 在朦胧的月光下,你看起来这么美。
